did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Hamlet: a Tragedy in Five Acts 1901
did.abstract: Original typescript, with handwritten notes, of Edward Hugh Sothern's acting version of Hamlet. Notations include stage manager's cues and floorplans. Included on the title page of each act is the statement, "This manuscript is the property of E.H. Sothern, Daly's Theatre, New York City."

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Hamlet: a Tragedy in Five Acts (MS 080). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: British playwright; Sothern was an American actor and author.

This production, with Sothern in the title role, was first presented at the Garden Theatre, New York on September 17, 1900. Also included in the cast are William Harris, Arthur R. Lawrence, Charlotte Deane, and Virginia Harned.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized by separately bound and paginated acts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Original typescript, with handwritten notes, of Edward Hugh Sothern's acting version of Hamlet. Notations include stage manager's cues and floorplans. Included on the title page of each act is the statement, "This manuscript is the property of E.H. Sothern, Daly's Theatre, New York City."

relatedmaterial.p: Published in 1901 by McClure, Phillips, & Co. N.Y., and titled "Hamlet, a Tragedy by William Shakespeare: The E.H. Sothern Acting Version."
Sothern has additional material in MS 020.
